attributes.action: End Violence and Discrimination through Early Years Education!
attributes.additional_details: 1 in 6 young citizens in the UK are experiencing record levels of anxiety & depression in a mental health pandemic. Gender-based violence & systemic racism continue unabated, all in the midst of an intensifying climate emergency. We have seen the government responding reactively and not preventatively. Evidence-based programmes, like Think Equal, prove that preventative measures do work. Therefore the government needs to reassess its' strategy & prioritize Early Years education.
attributes.background: We ask the UK government to take preventative action through Early Years education, as a solution against the mental health crisis and rampant violence, discrimination and inequality that are engulfing our communities. Changing the world is not rocket science - it's neuroscience!

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We understand that you are concerned about violence and discrimination, but it isn't clear how you would like the Government to implement a programme in early years education to prevent discrimination and violence. You could start a petition setting out clear actions for how you want the Government to do this.
